verses.text_plain: And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.
verses.verse_html: 1And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.

verses.text_plain: And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.
verses.verse_html: 2And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.

verses.text_plain: But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou succour us out of the city.
verses.verse_html:
3But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou succour us out of the city. ▼
▼ care…: Heb. set their heart on us
 , ▼
▼ worth…: Heb. as ten thousand of us
 , ▼
▼ succour: Heb. be to succour or help

footnotes.body_text: ▼ care…: Heb. set their heart on us
footnotes.body_html: ▼ care…: Heb. set their heart on us

footnotes.body_text: ▼ worth…: Heb. as ten thousand of us
footnotes.body_html: ▼ worth…: Heb. as ten thousand of us

footnotes.body_text: ▼ succour: Heb. be to succour or help
footnotes.body_html: ▼ succour: Heb. be to succour or help

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto them, What seemeth you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.
verses.verse_html: 4And the king said unto them, What seemeth you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.

verses.text_plain: And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.
verses.verse_html: 5And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.

tokens.text: for my sake with the young man

verses.text_plain: So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim;
verses.verse_html: 6So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim;

verses.text_plain: Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand men.
verses.verse_html: 7Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand men.

tokens.text: and there was there a great

verses.text_plain: For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
verses.verse_html:
8For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured. ▼
▼ devoured: Heb. multiplied to devour

footnotes.body_html: ▼ devoured: Heb. multiplied to devour

verses.text_plain: And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went away.
verses.verse_html: 9And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went away.

verses.text_plain: And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.
verses.verse_html: 10And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.

verses.text_plain: And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest him, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle.
verses.verse_html: 11And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest him, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle.

tokens.text: and why didst thou not smite

verses.text_plain: And the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand shekels of silver in mine hand, yet would I not put forth mine hand against the king’s son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none touch the young man Absalom.
verses.verse_html:
12And the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand shekels of silver in mine hand, yet would I not put forth mine hand against the king’s son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none touch the young man Absalom. ▼
▼ receive: Heb. weigh upon mine hand
 , ▼
▼ Beware…: Heb. Beware whosoever ye be of, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ receive: Heb. weigh upon mine hand
footnotes.body_html: ▼ receive: Heb. weigh upon mine hand

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Beware…: Heb. Beware whosoever ye be of, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Beware…: Heb. Beware whosoever ye be of, etc

verses.text_plain: Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against me.
verses.verse_html: 13Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against me.

tokens.text: and thou thyself wouldest have set

verses.text_plain: Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.
verses.verse_html:
14Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak. ▼
▼ with…: Heb. before thee
 , ▼
▼ midst: Heb. heart

tokens.text: in the midst of the oak

footnotes.body_html: ▼ with…: Heb. before thee

verses.text_plain: And ten young men that bare Joab’s armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.
verses.verse_html: 15And ten young men that bare Joab’s armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.

verses.text_plain: And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.
verses.verse_html: 16And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.

verses.text_plain: And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a very great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.
verses.verse_html: 17And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a very great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.

verses.text_plain: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar, which is in the king’s dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called unto this day, Absalom’s place.
verses.verse_html: 18Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar, which is in the king’s dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called unto this day, Absalom’s place.

verses.text_plain: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that the Lord hath avenged him of his enemies.
verses.verse_html:
19Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that the Lord hath avenged him of his enemies. ▼
▼ avenged…: Heb. judged him from the hand, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ avenged…: Heb. judged him from the hand, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ avenged…: Heb. judged him from the hand, etc

verses.text_plain: And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not bear tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day: but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king’s son is dead.
verses.verse_html:
20And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not bear tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day: but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king’s son is dead. ▼
▼ bear tidings this: Heb. be a man of tidings, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ bear tidings this: Heb. be a man of tidings, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ bear tidings this: Heb. be a man of tidings, etc

verses.text_plain: Then said Joab to Cushi, Go tell the king what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.
verses.verse_html: 21Then said Joab to Cushi, Go tell the king what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.

verses.text_plain: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But howsoever, let me, I pray thee, also run after Cushi. And Joab said, Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings ready?
verses.verse_html:
22Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But howsoever, let me, I pray thee, also run after Cushi. And Joab said, Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings ready? ▼
▼ howsoever: Heb. be what may
 , ▼
▼ ready: or, convenient

tokens.text: let me, I pray thee, also run
seeing that thou hast no tidings

footnotes.body_html: ▼ howsoever: Heb. be what may

verses.text_plain: But howsoever, said he, let me run. And he said unto him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran Cushi.
verses.verse_html: 23But howsoever, said he, let me run. And he said unto him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran Cushi.

verses.text_plain: And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.
verses.verse_html: 24And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.

verses.text_plain: And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.
verses.verse_html: 25And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.

verses.text_plain: And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.
verses.verse_html: 26And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.

verses.text_plain: And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.
verses.verse_html:
27And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings. ▼
▼ Me…: Heb. I see the running

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Me…: Heb. I see the running
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Me…: Heb. I see the running

verses.text_plain: And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed be the Lord thy God, which hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.
verses.verse_html:
28And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed be the Lord thy God, which hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king. ▼
▼ All…: or, Peace be to thee: Heb. Peace
 , ▼
▼ delivered…: Heb. shut up

footnotes.body_text: ▼ All…: or, Peace be to thee: Heb. Peace
footnotes.body_html: ▼ All…: or, Peace be to thee: Heb. Peace
▼ delivered…: Heb. shut up

verses.text_plain: And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king’s servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.
verses.verse_html:
29And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king’s servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was. ▼
▼ Is…: Heb. Is there peace?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Is…: Heb. Is there peace?

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.
verses.verse_html: 30And the king said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.

verses.text_plain: And, behold, Cushi came; and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the Lord hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.
verses.verse_html:
31And, behold, Cushi came; and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the Lord hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee. ▼
▼ Tidings: Heb. Tidings is brought

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Tidings: Heb. Tidings is brought

verses.text_plain: And the king said unto Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.
verses.verse_html: 32And the king said unto Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.

verses.text_plain: And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
verses.verse_html: 33And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
